content:
Hi,

I am wondering which resource is supposed to reference the Diagnosis-related group (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diagnosis-related_group).
I have seen it in (http://hl7.org/fhir/valueset-ex-diagnosisrelatedgroup.html):
- ExplanationOfBenefit
- Claim

But to me it is supposed to be related to a Encounter at some point. Any thought about that ?

Thanks by advance

DRGs are the "result" of a Diagnosis, Procedure, characteristics of the patient like age, gender, and a episoed of care/ encounter. Therfore it isn't just a resource but a combination of many resources. As the main purpose is reembursement this will lead to a claim in the end.
To capture the necessary combination of data - a profiled composition would be a possible way to go.

DRG is derived from a bunch of things, but in the end it's still a single coded assertion. Thus far, it's only been identified as a requirement on the claims side. If you think it needs to be on Encounter too, submit a change request.

@Lloyd McKenzie the Claims does have a (multiple) Encounter reference as Claim.item.encounter and also the packageCode to store the DRG. However there is no way to search by packageCode right now apparently. Is this a good stard to share DRG codes ?
@Paul Knapp @MaryKay McDaniel @Andy Stechishin?

@natus
How are you defining encounter in your question? Are you directly referencing the encounter resource? OR do you mean an "encounter" as in a zero pay claim? or the Medicaid definition of "encounter"?

Thanks!
MaryKay

Are you directly referencing the encounter resource

yes: a reference to an encounter resource
